nodes.text: The father of the Galactic Republic soldier Fideltin Rusk was a Chagrian male who lived on the planet Mindor during and before the Great Galactic War between the Republic and the reconstituted Sith Empire. A strong pacifist like many of his species, the man married his wife sometime before 3680 BBY, the year the two had their son Fideltin, and they raised him in the pacifist colony in which they lived. However, Rusk rebelled against the colony's ideals and enlisted in the Republic Military as soon as he was of age, and Rusk did not return to the colony throughout the Great Galactic War and the subsequent Cold War. In 3650 BBY, the colony was attacked by the Empire during an incursion into Republic space, and Rusk's parents were killed along with the rest of the colony.

The father of Fideltin Rusk, a companion character for the Jedi Knight class in the 2011 BioWare video game Star Wars: The Old Republic, was first mentioned in the Holonet section of the game's official site. Rusk also speaks about his family and their fates during the companion conversation "Passive Resistance," and the in-game Codex entry also mentions his family.
